intro: Neottianthe camptoceras, commonly known as the zigzag fern, is a species of fern characterized by its unique, undulating fronds. It belongs to the family Blechnaceae and is native to tropical regions of Central and South America. The plant features rhizomes that grow horizontally, supporting its upright, feather-like fronds. Its leaves are typically divided into narrow, linear segments, giving it a distinctive, zigzag appearance. Neottianthe camptoceras thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
